interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/03/06
Average Rating: 4.1
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jocelyn Moorhouse'], 'Producers': ['Sue Maslin'], 'Starring': ['Kate Winslet', 'Liam Hemsworth', 'Judy Davis'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Review Text: I'm trying to stay up on the reviews of movies which truly rivet me.  The Dressmaker - a film I'd likely pass by had it not been for Kate Winslet and Judy Davis being in the movie - was the best movie I've viewed so far in 2017.  It's backdrop is so depressing: a dusty forgotten town in the Australian outback from 1926 - 1951.  But from the presence of Kate arriving in town with one minute of film panning up to her face where we see her ruby red lips take a long drag of a cigarette is the "tell" that this is a movie like no other.  I haven't read the book and knew nothing of the unfolding of the story.  The cinematographer's use of juxtaposition (haute couture - brilliant color against the dreary town's dusty beige; the metamorphosis of Gertrude and so many other scenes I could point to. I won't say more - no spoiler review here.  Other than to say, this is a deep movie, with many subtleties of the prison's people make, regardless of their surroundings and all in their own mind.  Watch it for a fun romp into vintage 1950's couture or for a story of revenge or for the interplay between characters and the passage of time.  But watch it!
Review Title: Great story, GREAT actors, well written and well played.  Do yourself a favor and watch this movie!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
